thread.title: First Alert Forecast l Seasonably Mild This Weekend. Big Warm Up Christmas Week.
thread.title_full: First Alert Forecast l Seasonably Mild This Weekend. Big Warm Up Christmas Week.

author: @WRDW_WAGT
title: First Alert Forecast l Seasonably Mild This Weekend. Big Warm Up Christmas Week.
text:
First Alert Forecast l Seasonably Mild This Weekend. Big Warm Up Christmas Week.
Seasonal to above average highs through the end of the weekend. Staying dry the next 7 days.
AUGUSTA, Ga. (WRDW/WAGT) - Clear, cold nights with sunny, mild days with carry us through the weekend, but a cold front will bring a brief cooldown Monday ahead of a big warm up for the Christmas holiday.
After a cold, frosty start below freezing Saturday, the afternoon looks sunny with warmer than average highs in the lower to middle 60s. Wind will be light from the southeast at 3 to 6 mph.
Mostly clear and cold Saturday night into Saturday morning with overnight lows in the middle 30s. Wind will be light and variable.
Sunday will be partly sunny with a nice warm up into the middle 60s after a chilly start in the 30s. Wind will be from the northwest at 4 to 6 mph.
Temperatures will cool off Monday with highs only in the upper 50s. Past Monday, highs get back into the mid-60s Tuesday and then climb to the 70s Wednesday and Thursday (Christmas Day). Looking to stay dry next week with lots of sun.
Keep it here for regular updates and be sure to Download the WRDW First Alert Weather App to have the latest information in the palm of your hand whenever and wherever you need it
